solution_line_template: They ordered {oysters_dozen} dozen oysters at ${oyster_price_per_dozen} a dozen so that's {oysters_dozen}*{oyster_price_per_dozen} = $<<{oysters_dozen}*{oyster_price_per_dozen}={oyster_total}>>{oyster_total}

They ordered {shrimp_pounds} pounds of shrimp for ${shrimp_price_per_pound} a pound so that's {shrimp_pounds}*{shrimp_price_per_pound} = $<<{shrimp_pounds}*{shrimp_price_per_pound}={shrimp_total}>>{shrimp_total}

They ordered {clams_pounds} pounds of fried clams for ${clams_price_per_pound} a pound so that's {clams_pounds}*{clams_price_per_pound} = $<<{clams_pounds}*{clams_price_per_pound}={clams_total}>>{clams_total}
All total their bill comes to {oyster_total}+{shrimp_total}+{clams_total} = $<<{oyster_total}+{shrimp_total}+{clams_total}={bill_total}>>{bill_total}
Their bill was ${bill_total} and they are splitting it equally amongst {num_people} people so they each owe {bill_total}/{num_people} = $<<{bill_total}/{num_people}={each_owes}>>{each_owes}
